title: How to talk talk to your friends while in loading screen.
body:
I figure this may be general knowledge, but it case it's not;

On Windows:
1. Queue up and play a delightful game!
2. When in loading, "ALT TAB"
3. On the bottom right of your screen click the little arrow.
4. Look for a Riot icon, and click.
5. The client will open up again, with all you chats.

The chats also record like so there's none of that, your text is gone but there's is still all there. 

If someone post instruction for MAC I'll pop them up.

replies.body:
Its exactly the same for MAC (although some people have it as "command + tab")
When getting into game after the tabbing, you just go to the dock and click one of the league icons and it will magically appear.
I've being doing this for a long long time now id assume it would be common knowledge wouldn't it

Probabaly is, but there may be some people who don't know and will find this useful. 
Also we got the Riot explanation of how it all works now; sort of glad to learn that there are in fact 3 separate processes occurring.
yea well i didn't know so thanks aha
It's always a great idea to have two instances of this client open, adobe air is very stable.

This system doesn't create 2 instances of the client. It only brings up the client (which is already open in the background anyway).
When you launch League, the first thing that happens is the **patcher** loads. Once you click "LAUNCH" button, you will open the **client**.
When you press "PLAY" and after champion select you have the loading screen, you are launching **the game**.

If you open your task manager, you will see that when you are ingame, they are all 3 there... just not visible. What Skyprus is explaining here is just a way to see the client which gives you the possibility to chat with your friends.

I personally use this method quite often so I can say it is very safe :)

I've never had any issues, or two clients open. 
I don't know much about the technical side, but I think something separate opens up when you go in game.
After a game, that close and the client you opened before stays.
It's the same for mac. Just alt tab and open client.
Wow this whole time I use to just close the game to chat to people, after a few minutes I'd load the game again, thanks for the tip!
